intro: Phlegmariurus banayanicus, commonly known as the Banayanica thallus, is a species of liverwort belonging to the family Porellaceae. It is a non-vascular plant that thrives in moist, shaded environments, typically found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plant has a flattened, leafy structure with a distinct thallus that is often covered in a layer of fine, greenish filaments. Its reproductive structures, including antheridia and archegonia, are located on the underside of the thallus. This species plays a vital role in maintaining soil stability and moisture retention in its native habitats.
